column3: You are using social media since
column4: Average time you spent on social media everyday
column5: How often do you respond to the notification of social media?
column6: You spend a lot of time thinking about social media or planning how to use it.
column7: You feel an urge to use social media more and more.
column8: You use social media in order to forget about personal problems.
column9: You have tried to cut down on the use of social media without success.
column10: You become restless or troubled if you are prohibited from using social media.
column11: You use social media in a way that achieving your goals/academic score becomes tough/stressful.
column16: Use your phone with purpose (When you want to use your phone, consider the reason why)
column17: Avoid sleeping with mobile (keeping digital devices away for at least one hour before sleep)
column18: Remove your phone from your morning routine
column19: Keep your phone out of reach to focus on work
column20: Use social media as a treat (allow yourself to use social media for sometime when you have done your work/achieve something)
column21: Meet people offline whenever possible (Check In With Friends and Family)
column22: Purge your “friends” and “follow” lists time to time (People who probably don’t add positive value to your life and often trigger you into unnecessary conversations in social media)
column23: Take a break from social media time to time (once in a week)
column24: Invest time in physical activity/outdoor games
column26: Have lunch/dinner with family without phones
column28: Plan your time with conscious choice
